name: James Cook Hotel Grand Chancellor

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the James Cook Hotel Grand for one night and were impressed by the location and cleanliness of the property. We booked through the Wotif website and received free valet parking and 2 free drink vouchers for a very reasonable price. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Location
Modern hotel, good location
reviews.text: A good modern hotel near the centre of Wellington.

We stayed her for two nights 3rd & 4th August. We had a very late check-in on the first night at around midnight but this wasn't a problem. I booked the hotel through the Wotif website, it was one of those special prices where you don't find out the name of the hotel until you book. We were happy to take the gamble on a 4 star hotel in the Wellington CBD and were very happy to find we had got the James Cook hotel for $ 110.00 per night plus free parking.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think our room was called a superior room, it had a king size bed, small couch, small fridge/mini-bar, tea and coffee making facilities, and TV. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, although must admit we were only there to sleep, the room and bathroom were very clean, we were on the 25th floor and the room was very quiet. We would stay there again at the price we booked.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — The locals using the hotel lobby as a throughfare

reviews.text: We stayed at the James Cook for three nights in July - I booked this through a website. Each night came with a little extra.
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a truely disastrous stay at the Wellington YHA, I booked this hotel in blind desperation at 7 in the morning. We checked in at about 8.00am and they were great. Not charming or anything, but efficient. The hotel is clean, with facilities very much geared towards the Kiwi businessman. The room, while maybe a tad dated (lots of wood) was also clean and very comfortable. I note other quite negative comments on the site, but I thought this was a pretty good hotel It suffered from the usual rubbish gym, which they hastily put in as they felt a business hotel needed it, but otherwise was absolutely fine. Nicely located in the city centre, near restaurants, shops and not far from Te Papa. We had a nice drink at the bar when we got back from the restaurant in the evening and slept soundly.
reviews.title: a blessed relief

likes.disliked: — Too much wood in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was shabby, the sheets had holes in them and were very worn. The mattress was also very worn and uncomfortable - we ended up rolling to the middle all night! The heating didn't work properly (noisy fan), and the soundproofing was so poor that we could VERY clearly hear our neighbour in the shower :(
reviews.title: Would never go back....
Good for city
reviews.text: On complaining, we were told that we could have paid for an upgrade to a superior room!!! Having already paid $130 for a night, we thought the least we could expect would be a comfortable bed with decent sheets!!

reviews.title: Be warned - under renovation
reviews.text: Would certainly never go back and would NOT recommend to anyone else.

reviews.title: Better than most...
reviews.text: Spacious rooms and friendly, helpful staff - we enjoyed our short stay at this hotel and would stay again.

description: The James Cook Hotel Grand Chancellor is located in the heart of Wellington City and features a unique thoroughfare between the leading retail district of Lambton Quay and business hub of The Terrace. The Hotel features 268 accommodation rooms, two restaurants and bars, Bodyhaven Spa Style Boutique and a complimentary in-house gymnasium. High-speed internet connectivity is available throughout the hotel and the exclusive 26th floor Club Lounge offers the pinnacle of executive comfort with complimentary full buffet breakfasts, evening bar service and a business centre with spectacular harbour views. For meetings and events, the Hotel has a diverse selection of eight meeting and conference rooms, catering for up to 350 delegates. The entire conference floor and Whitby’s Restaurant can also be utilised for large events and tradeshows for up to 600 guests. The hotel offers fresh, modern facilities along with a state of the art sound system. The dedicated Functions team are on hand to provide advice, information and ideas along with professional and friendly assistance. Experience the highest standards of service at Wellington’s definitive accommodation and conference venue; the James Cook Hotel Grand Chancellor.
